title: Fix pond join/leave failing with 'user id not found' by making membership fully phrase-hash (userId) based

requirements.text: Update backend pond membership storage and logic so joining/leaving a pond uses Froggy Phrase hash identity (userId: Text) end-to-end, without requiring a userId→Principal lookup (userIdLinkage) and without relying on caller Principal for membership.

quotes: now it says "failed to join pond: user id not found".

acceptanceCriteria: Calling the backend join-pond flow with a valid userId no longer traps or returns an error mentioning that the userId was not found.
Anonymous users (shared principal 2vxsx-fae) do not appear as the same member; membership is determined by userId, not by caller principal.
Pond memberCount and any membership checks reflect userId-based membership consistently across join and leave operations.

requirements.text: Ensure backend join/leave pond operations correctly update the user profile’s joinedPonds list for the phrase-hash identity (userIdUserProfiles / getUserProfileByPhraseHash), creating a default profile if none exists for that userId, and never failing due to missing linkage records.

quotes: failed to join pond: user id not found

acceptanceCriteria: After successfully joining a pond, getUserProfileByPhraseHash(userId) returns a profile whose joinedPonds includes the pond name.
After successfully leaving a pond, the pond name is removed from joinedPonds for that userId.
If a userId has no existing profile, join/leave does not trap; a profile is created/updated so joinedPonds remains correct.

requirements.text: Implement a conditional Motoko state migration (backend/migration.mo) if required by the membership storage change, so existing deployed state upgrades safely and existing ponds remain readable after upgrade.

quotes: failed to join pond: user id not found

acceptanceCriteria: Upgrading the canister from the previous version does not trap during initialization or post-upgrade.
Existing ponds can still be fetched after upgrade (e.g., listPonds/getPond work) and have a valid memberCount/membership structure after migration.

requirements.text: Update frontend join/leave pond flows (React Query hooks and any UI components that surface join errors) so that after the backend fix, joining/leaving works without showing the previous 'user id not found' failure, and the UI refreshes membership-dependent queries correctly.

quotes: now it says "failed to join pond: user id not found".

acceptanceCriteria: From the pond join UI, a user can join a pond without receiving the 'user id not found' error.
After join or leave completes, the pond page/about sidebar reflects the new membership state without a manual refresh (member count and join/leave button state update).
No edits are made to frontend immutable paths (hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x), hooks/useActor.ts, main.tsx, components/ui).

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only add backend/migration.mo if a state upgrade is necessary.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any frontend immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Do not implement new authentication providers or third-party auth; Internet Identity remains the only supported auth option.
Do not add new social features or redesign unrelated parts of the app; focus only on fixing pond membership join/leave identity mismatch.
